metadata.topic: Just about every Windows and Linux device vulnerable to new LogoFAIL firmware attack
metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] Just about every Windows and Linux device vulnerable to new LogoFAIL firmware attack
metadata.email_text_original:
UEFIs booting Windows and Linux devices can be hacked by malicious logo images.
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Farstechnica.com%2Fsecurity%2F2023%2F12%2Fjust-about-every-windows-and-linux-device-vulnerable-to-new-logofail-firmware-attack%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Cf692450d379f4ab82e3708dbf6993031%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638374910023525826%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=z76ZzlNTPrKU8iop19pY%2BnYRVDWuS2JuOcek8yJZf50%3D&reserved=0
TL,DR: replace image on drive then boot. "Image parsers in UEFIs from all three
major IBVs are riddled with roughly a dozen critical vulnerabilities" -- You
received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups
"PatchManagement" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving
emails from it, send an email to patchmanagement+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com.
To view this discussion on the web visit
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgroups.google.com%2Fd%2Fmsgid%2Fpatchmanagement%2FSN6PR08MB55171E74468F35D6AFAB59F9B784A%2540SN6PR08MB5517.namprd08.prod.outlook.com&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Cf692450d379f4ab82e3708dbf6993031%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638374910023525826%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=8slt1ytIKIik4MfmrCmIO4gjCjDccSkWMi1u%2Fa%2BKCws%3D&reserved=0.
Link: None
metadata.evaluated_keywords: ['uefi boot windows', 'malicious logo image', 'three major ibv', 'dozen critical vulnerability']
